intro: Camellia yokdonensis, commonly known as the Korean camellia, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which bloom in late winter to early spring, come in shades of red, pink, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Camellia yokdonensis prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, thriving in temperate climates.
